markdown:
Skip to main content 

![](/sites/default/files/2022-12/trade-page-blank.png)

As a Tilesetter, your work will require intense precision, as you measure and cut a range of special materials to an exact fit. You’ll move through the motions of preparing and installing materials. This will include working in many settings—from swimming pools to commercial buildings, and more.

And you’ll align your math skills with a unique creativity that shines through in an artistic and practical creation.

#### What You'll Learn

  * How to prepare, measure and mark surfaces to be covered
  * How to build underbeds and install anchor bolts, wires and brackets
  * How to mix, apply and spread mortar, cement, mastic, glue or other adhesives
  * How to set, align, cut and fix tiles
  * How to install tile strips



#### Key Job Skills

  * Coordination 
  * Communication 
  * Material selection and recommendation 
  * Saw and cutter operations 
  * Trowelling and mortar preparation 



#### Technical Training

To get certified, you will need to sign up for technical training at an approved training provider in addition to on-the-job training. 

Visit [Trades Training BC](https://www.tradestrainingbc.ca/) and [EducationPlannerBC](https://educationplannerbc.ca/search) for a comprehensive list of what programs are available in your trade at public and non-public schools. 

For a list of all approved non-public training providers, [visit this page](/all-approved-training-providers-list).

Technical Training 12 weeks over 3 years 

Work-Based Training

4500 HOURS

General Skills

[Athletic](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AAthletic) [Collaborative](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3ACollaborative) [Mathematical](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AMathematical) [Precise](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3APrecise) [Tactile](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3ATactile)

## 

Program Updates

  * None
  * [OPSN Archives](https://skilledtradesbc.ca/program-standards-updates)



## 

Program Information and Resources

#### [Program Profile Occupational Description Tilesetters prepare bases, including waterproof membranes, metal lath and fasteners, and back-up materials pertaining to tile, mixing and use of cement mortars. They also apply a variety of tile—vitreous, quarry, ceramic, terrazzo, quartzite, glass, ceramic veneer, granite, slate, brick pavers, thin bricks and marble—to walls, floors and ceilings, fire places, steam rooms, arches, swimming pools, circular walls and stairways, and other areas. View PDF](/media/429/download)

#### [Program Outline Guidelines for delivery of technical training at SkilledTradesBC Recognized Training Providers View PDF](/media/428/download)

## 

Challenge the Trade

If you have significant work experience in a trade but have never been certified in Canada, you may apply to challenge the certification. Learn more about [How to Challenge a Skilled Trade](/challenge-skilled-trade).

OR

If you sponsor apprentices but have never been certified in Canada, you may request to supervise and sign-off apprentices when they are ready to be certified. Please [contact customer service](/contact-us) for more information.

#### [Instructions How to Apply View](https://skilledtradesbc.ca/instructions-challenge-certification) #### [Online Application Sign up for the Portal to start your online application Start Application](https://portal.skilledtradesbc.ca/Account/Login/Register?registrationType=certified) #### [Employer Declaration Document of relevant work experience View PDF](/media/830/download) #### [Statutory Declaration Attestation for self-employment/work experience when employer cannot be contacted View PDF](/media/831/download)
